title: Yahoo mail not working on Win 10 with FF 105.0.2 (64)
content:
Accessing mail.yahoo.com as I have for many years, recently many functions do not work in Yahoo mail with Windows 10. Cannot select a message, cannot reply or forward, cannot go back to messages clicking the "back" arrow, cannot select the settings button. Yahoo mail works correctly in Chrome however. How to fix??

This should sound familiar.... It's copied from a 2 year old thread on the FF boards. I cleared the cache and flushed all my cookies. I removed my recently added addon (Malware Bytes). Problem still there.
creator: canyontopher

title: firefox wont start. have tried nearly everything to remove and re-install
content:
Firefox stopped working today. Every time I launch it, it responds with: "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window."

I launched Task Manager and killed the active processes, relaunched ff - did not resolve the issue.

I have uninstalled and reinstalled ff multiple times - did not resolve the issue.

I have removed the lock as per here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-already-running-not-responding#:~:text=Right%2Dclick%20on%20an%20empty,it)%20and%20click%20End%20Process.

I have verified the access rights as per here: https://www.minitool.com/news/fix-firefox-is-already-running-but-is-not-responding.html

I have completely removed all the mozilla entries from both Program Files AND in the registry, then reinstalled. did not resolve the issue. registry instructions from here: https://www.reddit.com/r/firefox/comments/s9lguc/how_to_completely_uninstall_firefox/

I have tried to delete existing profiles AND create a new profile but I always get an error: "An unexpected error has prevented your changes from being saved." https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profile-manager-create-remove-switch-firefox-profiles#w_start-the-profile-manager-when-firefox-is-closed

I'm out of things to try. Hate to abandon Firefox but I'm at the end of my capabilities.
creator: list-a

title: Firefox 105 update corrupts places.sqlite
content:
Auto-updated to v105 today (105.0.2 64-bit Windows 10) and all bookmarks were gone. Not just gone but the bookmark manager seems not to be rendering properly (see attached image where there should be at least some elements drawn). Additionally, neither the bookmarks nor history left pane show anything (second attachment).

The 105 update was applied this morning when first opening the browser. Profile folder -> bookmarkbackups shows a backup from just before the update. Bookmark library -> Restore gives that backup as an option, but restoring that backup has no effect (does nothing).

Exiting Firefox and manually moving places.sqlite to a backup location and then restarting also has no effect. places.sqlite is rebuilt but library -> restore still has no effect.
creator: tikkoneus

title: Opening a Tweet in a new tab without switching to it
content:
I just made the switch from Chrome to Firefox, and I'm still trying to understand the small differences that exist between the 2 browsers.

While on Twitter, what I usually do is middle-click with my mouse on a Tweet to a new tab that I want to look into later, then continue scrolling down my timeline, then check out the Tweets I opened in the new tab(s). However, when I try to do the same thing on Firefox, it automatically opens the new tab. Because of how Twitter works, this also reloads the Home page when I opened it up, so I just lose anything I was just looking at when I opened the Tweet in a new tab.

What can I do differently here?

title: sync wont work
content:
HD crashed, had to rebuild. Installed Firefox, logged in, everything was great. Not the first time I have synced my account, its always worked before.

Initially, the sync worked but then I made a ADUC group membership change on my account. Someone had added domain-guest membership to my account which was deleting my windows profile every time i logged off. I removed the domain-guest membership and now my windows profile is saved but my firefox sync refuses to work. It completes but none of my information is there. I've been working on this for 6 hours, trying to load a backup to my profile, nothing works. What a nightmare.

I've pasted a copy of my old profile i had before my HD crashed. I pasted it into the profile location on the rebuild but firefox -profilemanager does NOT list the profiles i pasted into the folder, i have no idea why. They ARE there but it will not list them so i can't select them.

Ideas?

title: Opening Firefox from a link restores previous session. Opening from Menu doesn't.
content:
I've been using Firefox on Ubuntu since years ago, I use Firefox Sync and I have the browser configured to always restore previous session.

Some days ago I installed KDE desktop (I don't know if it has something to do with the issue) but since then, if I open Firefox from the panel or the KDE menu, it neither restore the previous session nor logs in Firefox Sync.

Either if I leave that new window open or not, If I click a http/https link, for example, from a Thunderbird email, it will open a new Firefox window with the last session and Firefox Sync logged in.

So, if I want to start with the last session tabs, I must open Firefox from an external link.

What can be the reason?

Thanks in advance!

Per ovviare al problema, mi chiedevo se fosse possibile implementare nella stessa pagina un "campo" note da abbinare ad ogni singolo account cosi da poter sapere con quale credenziali accedere.? title: Chybné načtení stránky s připojením přes proxy
content: Dobrý den. Používáme FireFox ve firemním prostředí. V poslední době od doby kdy vyšla verze 102 se začalo stávat, že některé webové stránky nejdou načíst celé. Načte se pouze jejich část a zobrazí jen to co načetl. Stránky by měli být naprogramovány správně. Problém se objevuje u více osob ve firmě a pravděpodobně to souvisí s nastavením proxy serveru. S naším proxy serverem se nějaké změny nekonaly. Když změním nastavení ve FireFoxu na "Automatické zjištění konfigurace proxy serverů" objeví se chyba uvedená výše. Když měním nastavení na "" tak se objevují zase jiné problémy, třeba nenačítají se externí fonty z Google API, aj. Žádná z dostupných položek proxy neřeší daný problém. Ve verzích nižších než 102.x.x se tento problém nevyskytuje a prohlížeč načítá stránky v pořádku. Jak mohu problém opravit?

title: Artstation and a blank screen
content:
Hello,

I'm having trouble with Artstation, and to be specific, whenever I click on an image to look at full, a blank screen shows up instead of the usual webpage format. The home page is fine, and the artists home page are fine, but when I click on an image, it's just a blank white page.

I've tried trouble shooting mode, and it seems to be one of my extensions - I use the bare minimum of the recommended set. I would like to not lose any of them - 1Password, Cookie AutoDelete, Disable WebRTC, Firefox's own Multi-Container extension, Ghostery, HTTPS everywhere, and uBlock Origin - for my own web browsing needs & I feel it unnecessary to use a different browser for one specific website. All the usual sites I venture out to work fine, it's just when clicking on the images to look at full view.

I do apologize for my ignorance if this question is more suited for Artstations support team, but thought it'd be best to ask here first.

So what actions should I take next, other than going one by one for each extension?

Many thanks in advance.
